actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the tenure in office of Supreme Court judges.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Limits the term of office of a Justice or judge of the United States to ten years during good behavior and permits a reappointment for a second term by the President. Provides that the term of a current Justice or judge shall expire: (1) December 31, 1983; or (2) ten years after such person took the oath of office, whichever occurs later.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States relating to the tenure in office of Supreme Court judges.
